intro: Asteromoea procera, commonly known as the tall asteromoea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Asteromoea procera is adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat, making it a resilient species in its environment.
